villain.bio: The oldest being in all the realms, Surtur is the Lord of Muspelheim and Odin's eternal rival. Wielding the Twilight Sword, Surtur seeks to destroy all the realms in fire, leaving nothing but the ashes of creation behind.

villain.bio: After the Pulse, an intelligent anomaly was detected in worldwide telecommunications networks. Hoping to control it, Hank Pym gave the anomaly a body and a name: Ultron. It rebelled against Pym, using its new capabilities to attempt world domination.

villain.bio: As an exiled member of the Inheritors, Karn seeks to redeem himself for the death of his mother in the eyes of his family by hunting all Spider-Totems across the Multiverse. However, his fate may also lie in the great web of life and destiny.

villain.bio: Selene Gallio can psionically drain the life force of others, rejuvenating herself and controlling her victim's mind. She has used this power to live for thousands of years, all the while cultivating her mastery of dark sorcery.
villain.cogBio: Selene Gallio can psionically drain the life force of others, rejuvenating herself and controlling her victim's mind. She has used this power to live for thousands of years, all the while cultivating her mastery of dark sorcery.
villain.name: SO16 Selene

villain.bio: Ahmet Abdol formed a cult around himself as the Living Pharaoh, after discovering that he could absorb cosmic energy and form it into blasts. If he absorbs enough energy, he can transform into the Living Monolith, a titan of nearly unstoppable power.
villain.cogBio: Ahmet Abdol formed a cult around himself as the Living Pharaoh, after discovering that he could absorb cosmic energy and form it into blasts. If he absorbs enough energy, he can transform into the Living Monolith, a titan of nearly unstoppable power.
villain.name: SO16 Living Monolith

villain.bio: When Apocalypse begins his genocidal conquest, he recruits mutants to serve as his "Four Horsemen". Brainwashed and twisted to serve his interests, they are granted even greater power than they had before.
villain.cogBio: When Apocalypse begins his genocidal conquest, he recruits mutants to serve as his "Four Horsemen". Brainwashed and twisted to serve his interests, they are granted even greater power than they had before.
villain.name: SO16 Iceman

villain.bio: The billionaire Black King of the Hellfire Club, Sebastian Shaw is a mutant with the power to absorb kinetic force, giving him super-strength and invulnerability.
villain.cogBio: The billionaire Black King of the Hellfire Club, Sebastian Shaw is a mutant with the power to absorb kinetic force, giving him super-strength and invulnerability.
villain.name: SO22 Sebastian Shaw Boss

villain.bio: Vlad Dracula was a feared Transylvanian warlord better known as “Vlad the Impaler.” When he was mortally wounded, Dracula was turned into a vampire and took the title of “the Lord of Vampires.”
villain.cogBio: Vlad Dracula was a feared Transylvanian warlord better known as “Vlad the Impaler.” When he was mortally wounded, Dracula was turned into a vampire and took the title of “the Lord of Vampires.”
villain.name: SO22 Dracula Boss

villain.bio: With all the training of Dr. Strange and none of the morality, Baron Mordo is a fearsome master of the arcane. He often works with Dormammu and other forces of darkness in his quest to overcome the Sorceror Supreme.
villain.cogBio: With all the training of Dr. Strange and none of the morality, Baron Mordo is a fearsome master of the arcane. He often works with Dormammu and other forces of darkness in his quest to overcome the Sorceror Supreme.
villain.name: SO22 Baron Mordo Boss

villain.bio: Few can claim to match the evil might of the arch-demon Mephisto. His power in our dimension is small as yet, but grows stronger as he acquires the souls of mortals. To do so, he must subjugate another's will through the victim signing a demonic pact.
villain.cogBio: Few can claim to match the evil might of the arch-demon Mephisto. His power in our dimension is small as yet, but grows stronger as he acquires the souls of mortals. To do so, he must subjugate another's will through the victim signing a demonic pact.
villain.name: SO22 Mephisto Boss

villain.bio: General "Thunderbolt" Ross's obsession with destroying the Hulk led him to undergo gamma ray treatments himself, transforming him into the fearsome Red Hulk.
villain.cogBio: General "Thunderbolt" Ross's obsession with destroying the Hulk led him to undergo gamma ray treatments himself, transforming him into the fearsome Red Hulk.
villain.name: S15 M01H Red Hulk

villain.bio: In childhood, Magneto survived Auschwitz while developing control over all forms of electromagnetism. Believing humanity would try to destroy mutants just as the Nazis destroyed his family, he founded the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants.
villain.cogBio: In childhood, Magneto survived Auschwitz while developing control over all forms of electromagnetism. Believing humanity would try to destroy mutants just as the Nazis destroyed his family, he founded the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants.
villain.name: S15 M02H Magneto

villain.bio: A trickster and would-be usurper, Loki schemes constantly, forever carrying a grudge over the death of his father and the Aesir's love for his step-brother Thor.
villain.cogBio: A trickster and would-be usurper, Loki schemes constantly, forever carrying a grudge over the death of his father and the Aesir's love for his step-brother Thor.
villain.name: S15 M03H Loki

villain.bio: Child prodigy Bruce Banner became inadvertently exposed to the radiation of a prototype Gamma Bomb. This granted him the power to transform into the nearly invulnerable Hulk—but at the cost of suffering the consequences of the Hulk’s unthinking rages.
villain.cogBio: Child prodigy Bruce Banner became inadvertently exposed to the radiation of a prototype Gamma Bomb. This granted him the power to transform into the nearly invulnerable Hulk—but at the cost of suffering the consequences of the Hulk’s unthinking rages.
villain.name: S15 M01V Hulk

villain.bio: Born wealthy, Emma Frost didn't need her mutant powers to succeed in the world, but she still took advantage of them. Her telepathic powers won her an invitation to the notorious Hellfire Club, where she rose in rank to become the White Queen.
villain.cogBio: Born wealthy, Emma Frost didn't need her mutant powers to succeed in the world, but she still took advantage of them. Her telepathic powers won her an invitation to the notorious Hellfire Club, where she rose in rank to become the White Queen.
villain.name: S15 M02V Emma Frost

villain.bio: Exiled to Midgard by his father Odin, the Norse god of thunder, Thor walks among humanity to learn humility. It’s not an easy lesson for him, especially not when he’s practically invincible and armed with the divine hammer Mjolnir.
villain.cogBio: Exiled to Midgard by his father Odin, the Norse god of thunder, Thor walks among humanity to learn humility. It’s not an easy lesson for him, especially not when he’s practically invincible and armed with the divine hammer Mjolnir.
villain.name: S15 M03V Thor

villain.bio: Professor X’s first student, Scott Summers is one of the X-Men’s leaders. Able to discharge devastating energy bolts from his eyes via a breach between universes, Cyclops is one of the most powerful mutants to graduate the School of Gifted Youngsters.
villain.cogBio: Professor X’s first student, Scott Summers is one of the X-Men’s leaders. Able to discharge devastating energy bolts from his eyes via a breach between universes, Cyclops is one of the most powerful mutants to graduate the School of Gifted Youngsters.
villain.name: S03 M03 Cyclops

villain.bio: Herbert Wyndham was a geneticist, cast out for his inhuman experiments. He evolved his own mind using a genetic accelerator. As the High Evolutionary, he seeks to evolve all life on Earth to perfection… with or without their consent.
villain.cogBio: Herbert Wyndham was a geneticist, cast out for his inhuman experiments. He evolved his own mind using a genetic accelerator. As the High Evolutionary, he seeks to evolve all life on Earth to perfection… with or without their consent.
villain.name: SO34 High Evolutionary M1 Boss

villain.bio: The Sentinel M-Series Tau Mk III is an advanced android repurposed by Magneto. He altered them to eliminate "Humans" as opposed to "Mutants".
villain.cogBio: The Sentinel M-Series Tau Mk III is an advanced android repurposed by Magneto. He altered them to eliminate "Humans" as opposed to "Mutants".
villain.name: C06 M04 Elite M-Series Flame

villain.bio: Also known as Madame Hydra, the woman who took control of Hydra's New York operations comes from a mysterious background and has managed to keep her identity secret.
villain.cogBio: Also known as Madame Hydra, the woman who took control of Hydra's New York operations comes from a mysterious background and has managed to keep her identity secret.
villain.description: Viper is quick and cunning. She's highly trained in a variety of weapons, and she tends to favor poisons in her attacks.
villain.name: C01 M01 Viper
